newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares surge on institutional buying.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares surge on institutional buying.

text.p: Share prices on the Delhi Stock Exchange closed higher on Thursday, fuelled by institutional buying at lower levels, brokers said.
The bourse's benchmark index closed 9.51 points higher at 768.50.
Brokers said share prices had already bottomed out and they expected a further rally in the coming sessions.
"The recovery was a technical correction which was long due as stocks are in an over-sold position," said Bharat Bhushan of brokers Nu-Era Equities.
Reliance Industries surged 12.60 rupees to 295.90 on heavy buying by speculators and institutional investors, brokers said.
State Bank of India rose 4.20 rupees to 306.00.
Larsen and Toubro closed 2.80 rupees higher at 206.80. The company announced its 1996/97 (April-March) net profit increased to 4.1 billion rupees from 3.9 billion in the previous year.
